alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 11:43AM PST until March 04 at 7:55AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The flood waters are cresting on the Chehalis river at Porter and will gradually recede below flood stage late Thursday night. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PST Thursday the stage was 48.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM PST Thursday was 48.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and will continue falling to 38.2 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 745 PM PST.
